passages.text: USA|Aerospace & Defense Electronics
Tidbits from the 10-Q: FSE in the 25 Club Driven by Mix and 37% Incremental

We highlight four takeaways from the 10-Q: 1) FSG organic incremental of 37% in FQ3;2) ETG organic +7% incl 4pts from Other and 5pts from Space; 3) $48MM cash use from inventory driven by Materials; and 4) $344MM paid for Gables or ~4X Sales.

**FQ3 (July Q) FSG Growth Included 5pts from Millennium/Capewell/HON Display and +13%** **Organic.** In FQ3:25, FSG grew 13% organically, driven by 15% organic growth in Repair & Overhaul (25% of sales) and Aftermarket Parts (61% of sales) up 12% organically. Specialty Products sales (14% of segment) grew 10% driven by missile defense strength, while the OE business lagged. M&A contributed $35MM to FQ3, or $8MM from Capewell, $10MM from Millennium, and $17MM from the HON product line acquisition on our est. On a reported basis, FQ3 FSG sales expanded 18% with Commercial Aero +23% and Defense & Space +7%. From a profitability perspective, FSG margin of 24.7% included a $6MM benefit from lower SG&A. The implied incremental is 37% with our FY25 est incorporating a 32% incremental and 33% YTD.

**Defense & Space (51% of sales) Grew +8% in FQ3 with Other Electronics Leading +10%.** ETG segment is driven primarily by Defense & Space representing 51% of sales, followed by Electronics at 30% and Commercial Aero at 19%. ETG revs grew 7% organically as $14MM grew Space (+5pts), Other Electronics grew $11MM (+4pts to growth), Defense grew $8MM organically (+2pts to growth), and $5MM from Aerospace (+2pts), whereas Medical was down $5MM (2pts). This is the second positive organic growth Q (5% YTD) for Other Electronics with FY25 est of 3% for the sub-segment and 5% overall ETG organic growth. FQ3 margins for ETG contracted to 22.8% from 23.5% in FQ3:24 driven by higher SG&A due to higher incentive comp (-100 bps). FYTD margins have been 22.9% w/ FY25 of 22.7% incorporating 22.3% in FQ4.

**Acquisitions EV Totaled $344MM in FQ3 and $XMM FY25 to Date; Gables Engineering, or an est** **4.3X sales.** HEI spent $344MM on M&A in FQ3 for 100% of Fables Engineering (Jul 24, '25 close, est $80MM revs). Earlier in the year, HEI deployed $31MM for Rosen Aviation (Apr '25 close, ~$20MM in revs), and $255MM across SVM (est $60MM EV, $12MM revs), HON AIMS Products Line (Dec '24 close, est $30MM revs), and 90%of Millennium (Jan '25 close, est $12MM revs). The company has $775MM of unused revolver capacity after drawing down $170MM from the revolver during FQ3 to support the acquisition of Gables (3rd largest acquisition by EV ever). During FQ2, the owner of 20% of a subsidiary of HFSC acquired in 2006 exercised an option to require HEI to purchase another 5% of the asset over 4-yr period from May 2025 through FY28. In FQ3, HEI sold a 10% NCI in a subsidiary of HFSC acquired in FY20 w/an option for the NCI holders to cause HEI to repurchase the stake over a 4yr period in FY31.
**FQ3 R** **Totaled $31.9MM vs $29.8MM in FQ3:24.** This was up 7% y-o-y off of a 16% increase in sales for 2.8% of sales vs 3.0% in FQ3:24.
**Continued on next page...**

Please see analyst certifications, important disclosure information, and information regarding the status of non-US analysts on pages 10-15 of this report. * Jefferies LLC / Jefferies Research Services, LLC

Source: FactSet, Jefferies estimates
**Ellen Page * | Equity Associate**
**Conor Walters * | Equity Associate**

Buy rating based on 1) upside to commercial aftermarket (58% of PF sales), due to an expanding addressable fleet of aircraft in FY25 and FY26 with DD organic growth once more in FY25 at FSG; 2) improving defense spending backdrop supports a return to growth at ETG; 3) Net leverage of \(>2X\) with a return to \(>100\%\) FCF generation to support further M&A runway.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

- Revenues grow 11% organically in FY25 (16% total) and 6% organic (8% total) in FY26 due to a recovery in commercial aero.- Aftermarket grows 14% organically in FY25 and 8% in FY26 with no further acquisition contribution assumed. ETG +4% in FY26E.- FY26 Margins of 22.5%, up 110 bps from 21.4% in FY24.- PT of \(380:1\) 42.0x FY26E EV/EBITDA (186% premium vs 3-yr average 133% premium to S&P); 2) 70.6x FY26E P/E (230% premium vs 3-yr average 171% premium to S&P); and 3) 1.6% FY26E FCF yield (143% premium vs 3-yr 98% premium to S&P).

- Revenues grow 22% in FY26, supported by the commercial AM recovery closer to the 32% expected addressable fleet expansion and new product penetration. ETG +6% w/both end markets stronger.- Additional acquisitions add to top-and bottom-line growth.- Operating margins of 23.0% incl Wencor margins at legacy FSG levels and expansion toward historical ETG rates.- PT \(\)410:2026\(EPS:\) \ \(5.30\) .- Target Multiple: 78x P/E (240% premium vs. 3-yr average 171% premium to S&P).

- Volumes flat in FY26 due to aftermarket weakness and ETG declines as Defense & Space face delays and Other Electronics is affected by weaker macro.- Operating margins to 20.3% on mix and inefficiencies at ETG.- Margins trend lower due to lower volume contribution, potentially dilutive acquisitions, and unfavorable mix.- Recent acquisitions fail to achieve targets.- PT \(\)190:2026\(EPS:\) \ \(3.45\) Target Multiple: 55.7x (150% prem to S&P vs 3-yr average 171%).

Top Material Issue(s)Employee Engagement, Diversity & Inclusion - Heico is a family-owned business that is committed to expanding diversity across the firm, noting that more than half of the company's team members belong to ethnic/racial minority groups. Heico has the longest-tenured management team across our coverage, at 26.3 years, on average, and the longest-tenured board of directors, at 0.4 years, on average.

Company Target(s): 1) The company has not provided ESG targets. 2) The Environmental, Safety and Health Committee of the board of directors oversees compliance with federal and state regulations, with most facilities designated Small Quantity Generators or Very Small Quantity Generators in terms of the local environmental impact.
Qs to Mgmt: 1) Do you intend to quantify HEI's environmental footprint and diversity metrics, and are you exploring setting defined goals across sustainability, diversity, and governance?
The Five ESG Issues Investors Should Look At When Investing in A&D

- Accretive acquisitions boost margins and bottom line.- Evidence of revenue synergies from Wencor integration.- PMA share gains and continued recovery in aftermarket sales with support from expanding addressable fleet.- Evidence of PMA sales to the DOD.- New production introductions drive business wins- Reacceleration of growth in Other Electronics

**Inventory Build Driven by Materials.** HEI reported a \(\) 48MM\(cash inventory build in FQ3 (\)\\(60MMFYTD)\)w/reported inventory incl M&A of \(\) 1.31\(BB,up from\)\\(1.77BB\) to start the FY (Oct 31) and from \(\) 1.24BB\(at FQ2 (Apr). The increase in inventory in FQ3 was driven by a\) \ \(5MM\) increase in Finished Goods, and a \(\) 19MM\(build in WIP, and Materials +\) \ \(42\) HEI generated OCF of \(\) 231MM\(vs capex of\) \ \(13MM\) for FCF of \(\) 218MM\(, which is up 10% from\) \ \(198MM\) in FQ3:24. The company reaffirmed guidance of \(\) 65-70MM\(of capex in FY25.\)
HEI trades at a significant premium to its peers on most metrics, including 121% on 2026E P/E and 80% on 2026E EV/EBITDA.
Exhibit 2 - Relative Valuation Table (8/28/2025)
Source: Company data, Jefferies estimates
Please see important disclosure information on pages 10 - 15 of this report.

HEI is currently trading at a consensus FY2 PE multiple of \(59.8x\) , \(15\%\) above its three- year average of \(52.0x\) . On a market- relative basis, the stock is \(179\%\) above the S&P vs its three- year average of a \(172\%\) premium.
Exhibit 3 - Trading at 59.8X FY2 P/E, 179% Prem to Mkt vs. Historical Avg Prem of 172%
Source:FactSet,Jefferies estimates
On EV/EBITDA multiple, HEI is trading \(35.4x\) or a \(16\%\) premium to its 3- year average of \(30.7x\) and at a \(142\%\) premium to the S&P vs its three- year average premium of \(133\%\) .
Exhibit 4 - Trading at 35.4X FY2 EV/EBITDA, 142% Prem to Mkt vs. Historical Avg Prem of 133%
Source:FactSet,Jefferies estimates

On a FCF yield basis, HEI currently trades on a consensus FY2 FCF yield of \(2.0\%\) , which is \(16\%\) premium to its three- year average of \(2.3\%\) . On a market- relative basis, the stock trades at a \(92\%\) premium to the S&P vs a three- year average premium of \(99\%\) .
Exhibit 5 - Trading at a \(2.0\%\) FY2 FCF Yield, \(92\%\) Prem to Mkt vs. Historical Avg Prem of \(99\%\)
Source: FactSet, Jefferies estimates

Heico CorporationHeico is the world's largest independent manufacturer of FAA- approved jet engine and aircraft component replacement parts other than the original equipment manufacturers (OEMs). The company is a leading supplier commercial airlines, repair facilities, and defense and industrial customers. No single customer generates more than \(10\%\) of sales. Heico's long- term organic growth is predicated on higher aircraft deliveries resulting in more parts. Heico is able to differentiate its product offering by providing superior component design and by aligning its technology with the needs of its major customers. About \(50\%\) of Heico's sales are to the Parts Manufacturer Approval (PMA), which we believe is about \(1\text{BB}\) in addressable market. The PMA market accounts for only \(3 - 4\%\) of the commercial aerospace aftermarket.
Heico CorporationOur price target is based on historical valuation and a blend of EV/EBITDA, P/E, and DCF. Downside risks include lower demand for air travel, lack of new products, and competition.
For Important Disclosure information on companies recommended in this report, please visit our website at https://javatar.bluematrix.com/sellside/ Disclosures.action or call 212.284.2300.

Explanation of Jefferies RatingsBuy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies methodology for assigig ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
